problem_text: A man is either kind or evil. No ugly person is handsome. All evil people are ugly. All gentlemen are handsome. All CEOs are gentlemen. Harry is a gentleman.
predicates:
Man(x) ::: x is a man.
Kind(x) ::: x is kind.
Evil(x) ::: x is evil.
Ugly(x) ::: x is ugly.
Handsome(x) ::: x is handsome.
Gentleman(x) ::: x is a gentleman.
CEO(x) ::: x is a CEO.
Harry(x) ::: x is Harry.

tests.questions: Based on the above information, is the following statement true or false? Harry is not ugly.
Based on the above information, is the following statement true or false? If Harry is a CEO and handsome, then Harry is not evil.
Based on the above information, is the following statement true or false? If Harry is a man and handsome, then Harry is not evil.
Based on the above information, is the following statement true or false? If Harry is a man and evil, then Harry is ugly.
Based on the above information, is the following statement true or false? If Harry is a CEO and not ugly, then Harry is kind.
Based on the above information, is the following statement true or false? If Harry is a man and kind, then Harry is not ugly.
Based on the above information, is the following statement true or false? If Harry is a CEO, then Harry is handsome.
Based on the above information, is the following statement true or false? Harry is either a man and ugly, or neither a man nor ugly.
tests.conclusions: Harry is a man and a gentleman, and no gentleman is ugly. TRUE

tests.questions: Based on the above information, is the following statement true or false? If Harry is a man and CEO, then Harry is handsome.
Based on the above information, is the following statement true or false? If Harry is a man and ugly, then Harry is evil.
